titleStmt.title: Seven Iesuites condemned. Shewing every particular thing in their examination, and confession, at the sessions House in the Old Bayly in a true and exact relation. Likewise describing what severall and erroneous opinions they doe maintaine against the oath of allegeance, and the kings prerogative. As also, in a briefe demonstration, how they labour to seduce Protestants in England to the Church of Rome, and how they confirme the Popes primacie. The names of the Iesuites: Hamant. Winefall. Cannon. Willford. Ragmore. Coleman. Rivers.

Seven Iesuites condemned. Shewing every particular thing in their examination, and confession, at the sessions House in the Old Bayly in a true and exact relation. Likewise describing what severall and erroneous opinions they doe maintaine against the oath of allegeance, and the kings prerogative. As also, in a briefe demonstration, how they labour to seduce Protestants in England to the Church of Rome, and how they confirme the Popes primacie. The names of the Iesuites: Hamant. Winefall. Cannon. Willford. Ragmore. Coleman. Rivers.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
